text: An easy way to get to it is open the blog and click the little HubSpot in the upper right hand and you should see "Edit Listing Template"
Thanks! That's exactly what I needed. :slightly_smiling_face:

The blogs method is not the cleanest unfortunately.  There are better ways like having an element that you target and use JS to add the formatting. That was not the way it was done for this blog. In this case I think someone painstakingly copied the inline styles.

---

I would advise anyone looking to create code blocks like this to follow more what we do on the developers website itself.

We built a custom module that uses prism.js and prism.css to format HubL and other languages. We escapejinjava and escape all special characters. HubL is  HubSpots version of JinJava, which is based on Jinja. So Jinja syntax highlighting works for HubL.
For HTML, CSS, JS you can use a codepen. For HubL, there arenâ€™t many editor friendly ways of tackling it.
ahh ok that makes sense, thanks!
